meanings.definition: A person who performs balancing acts or stunts.
meanings.sent1: The equilibrists amazed the audience with their tightrope walking.
meanings.sent2: The circus featured talented equilibrists who could balance on chairs stacked high.
meanings.sent3: The equilibrists decided to have a balancing competition to see who could stay upright the longest.
meanings.sent4: Watching the equilibrists on stage was like witnessing a delicate dance between gravity and skill.
meanings.sent5: The equilibrists' performance left a lasting impression on everyone who saw it.

meanings.sent1: The equilibrists in the show all wore colorful costumes.
meanings.sent2: At the circus, the equilibrists' act was the highlight of the night.
meanings.sent3: The equilibrists gathered backstage, excited to showcase their balancing talents.
meanings.sent4: The group of equilibrists moved in perfect harmony during their performance.
meanings.sent5: The audience cheered loudly as the equilibrists completed their daring stunts.
